solution_line_template: There were {more_girls} + {males} = <<{more_girls}+{males}={girls}>>{girls} girls in the party.
So, there were a total of {males} + {girls} = <<{males}+{girls}={total_attendees}>>{total_attendees} attendees.
{total_attendees} x {cans_per_attendee} = <<{total_attendees}*{cans_per_attendee}={total_cans_needed}>>{total_cans_needed} cans of soft drinks are needed.
So, Mary bought {total_cans_needed}/{cans_per_box} = <<{total_cans_needed}/{cans_per_box}={boxes_bought}>>{boxes_bought} boxes of soft drinks.
Therefore, Mary spent {boxes_bought} x ${price_per_box} = $<<{boxes_bought}*{price_per_box}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} on soft drinks.
